channel.title: Stephen Daniel Okita's Blog
channel.description: Thoughts on philosophy, technology, and life from Stephen Daniel Okita

item.title: The harmonises of darkness
item.description: This is about Nocturnes. I really wanted to write about music and write poetry. This guy at a party last night told me about Field and I have spent the morning devouring his work. These are my reflections.

item.title: The Echo in the Machine
item.description: An essay on AGI for CogSci 100.

item.title: CRITQUE UNBOUND?
item.description: Scitzos email I have redacted and edited a little in exploring why and maybe how we need to make the language of critque universal. I never sent this email for good reason, I sent it to my friend and decided to never publish it, but here it is!

item.title: Make Evil Conscious Again!
item.description: I enjoy writing this type of critique, I don't know if anyone will understand but maybe the imagery is fun.

item.title: Linux is cool!
item.description: What is linux, brief history and what do know when you switch.

item.title: What Did Nick Land See?
item.description: My attempt to execute the madness brought about by Fanged Neuomena. I needed to make this artistic, to try and plug a little more holes.

item.guid: https://stephenokita.com/Divine Will and the Dance of Being
item.title: Divine Will and the Dance of Being
item.link: https://stephenokita.com/Divine Will and the Dance of Being
item.description: Conway and Leibniz on God's Agency in Creation. Another philosophy essay for class, this ones not to bad pretty boring IMO.

item.title: REVELATION MUST BE DEFENDED
item.description: I know what ethics is now(ish), this is an attempt to describe it and give some didactic knowledge.

item.title: Historical Map of Philosophies
item.description: An experiment with Mermaid as well as a pretty interesting retrospection on the history of knowledge.

item.title: The Ethic of Univocity
item.description: For Berkeley's 25B, analysing Spinoza's determinism and the aura of ethics under monism.

item.title: Decentralised KYC & DIDs
item.description: Finally a tech article. Exploring user verification in a anonymous and decentralised social. Pretty much anti-corruption of DAOs.

item.title: Free Agency for Frankfurt and Watson
item.description: Very technical piece on free agency and the conceptions of the will for Frankfurt and Watson. Done for Phil 109 under R Jay Wallace

item.title: The Ethic of Spectacular Cynicism
item.description: A follow up on the philosophers death article but way more technical.

item.title: Spinoza vs Descartes
item.description: A presentation I did for Philosophy Class that I am including the link for here.

item.title: The Importance of a Philosophers Death
item.description: Inspired by something James Porter said in class. Try to argue that it's not important. If you don't care about that just skip to the end and read the list it's very fun.

item.guid: https://stephenokita.com/Freedom as a theory of value
item.title: Individual Value, as Determined by the Gradations of Freedom
item.link: https://stephenokita.com/Freedom as a theory of value
item.description: I want to apologise again for the jargon and maybe the unfamiliar mathematical/logical notation. I think this an interesting way of valuing people, as thanks to Kant we value freedom so much.

item.title: Kant was right
item.description: After righting about compatiblism for a while I reread the groundwork and thought I should write this up just in case anyone was lost on the answer for ethics. Sorry in advance for the jargon, it is Kant in fairness :)

item.title: 感情商品化是什麼?
item.description: 了解“感情商品化“的意思而這句話的結果

item.title: The Marketplace of Emotions? 感情商品化 english version
item.description: This is claude-3.7 Sonnets translation of my 感情商品化 article, so that international audiences can understand

item.title: 感情商品化是什么？(简化版)
item.description: 了解"感情商品化"的意思和这句话的结果

item.title: Unfinished or Expired Ideas and Authenticity
item.description: Introducing cult of done, rant about self fulfilling nature of productivism, long exposition on the self action and identity spectra. Conclusion of introducing the idea grave yard at the bottom of the page.

item.title: Why are we moral relativists?
item.description: Cultural relativism makes no sense, but then why is it so common? I think the answer is subjective realism, which I don't know if is a new term I made up but is probably my favourite piece of writing in a long time.

item.title: The Impossibility of Eudaemonia
item.description: Another philosophy class paper on Aristotle
